topic: Assisted suicide should be a criminal offence
arguments: ["a cure or treatment may be discovered shortly after having ended someone's life unnecessarily.", 'allow assisted suicide could allow unscrupulous people to become serial killers', 'Allowing assisted suicide would enable greedy relatives to take advantage of ill relatives for their own financial gain', 'an assisted suicide is just another way to murder a person. it does not matter if the person asked to be killed the person who does the killing has put one to death.', 'and who defines reasonable certainty, how many people evicted by medicine has regained health thanks to an alternative treatment or a medical advance, ending life is not the solution, much less involving others', 'anyone who contributes to ending a life should be punished', 'asisted suicide can be abused by those who want to benefit from taking advantage of a sick or ill relative and thus should not be allowed.', 'assisted suicide could be misused by people who want their weaker partner to die. people could be encouraged to take their own life before they really want to.', 'assisted suicide goes directly against the oath taken by doctors to do no harm. suicide is harm. there is no oversight when giving the patients the drugs. they are prescribed and the patient faces death alone.', 'assisted suicide involves murdering someone which is illegal and should be treated as such.', 'assisted suicide is a crime and people involved should be sent to prison', 'Assisted suicide is a criminal offence as it centers on the intentional death of a human being.', 'assisted suicide is a form of murder and should be a criminal offense', 'assisted suicide is a form of murder and should be treated as a crime', 'assisted suicide is a form of murder and should never be allowed.', 'assisted suicide is against the oath all doctors take.', 'assisted suicide is another form of homicide', 'assisted suicide is another type of murder.', 'assisted suicide is equivalent to murder and should be treated as such.', 'assisted suicide is heartless and inhumane', 'assisted suicide is immoral and a crime', 'assisted suicide is just another form of murder. murder is illegal so assisted suicide must be illegal as well.', 'assisted suicide is just another word for murder.', 'assisted suicide is just helping a person kill a person which seems like i should be a criminal offence.', 'assisted suicide is just like accessory to murder', 'Assisted suicide is just murder by another name and it should be punished accordingly.', "assisted suicide is killing by another name - it is far too open to abuse by those with a vested interest, since it is often impossible to accurately interpret the intentions of the individual being 'assisted'.", 'assisted suicide is killing someone even if it is at their request', 'assisted suicide is murder and therefore illegal', 'assisted suicide is murder of another and should be considered a criminal offence.', 'assisted suicide is murder, the doctor is giving the weapon to the person with the sole purpose of death.', 'assisted suicide is not only immoral but is also a form of murder and should be a criminal offence.', 'assisted suicide is nothing but murder. you are giving a human the ability to legally kill another. this should be stopped. no person should be allowed to cause a death of another.', 'assisted suicide is nothing short of murder and it should be a criminal offence.', 'assisted suicide is really just another word for murder or homicide,', 'assisted suicide is still one person essentially killing another', 'assisted suicide is still suicide, which is immoral in all forms.', 'assisted suicide is still suicide, which is wrong in all forms.', 'assisted suicide is the same as murder and therefore should be illegal.', 'assisted suicide is too dangerous as if someone is weak and feeble a manipulative person could encourage them to kill themselves when they do not really want to.', 'assisted suicide is unethical how do we know that the person who is assisting the suicide hasnt got something to gain from the death of the other person', 'Assisted suicide should be a crime to prevent greedy individuals from killing their family member to get their money and property', "Assisted suicide should be a criminal offence as if the person cannot make their own decisions and actions then it would be impossible to know if the person helping wasn't just murdering them.", 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence as it is another form of murder', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because after they are dead no one will know what actually happened whether it was assisted suicide or if it was murder', "assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because againts the god's law", 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because it causes the death of a human being just the same as if taken by a criminal.', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because it could force some doctors to perform this act without their consent', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because it does not allow a person to die a natural death.', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because it is morally wrong', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because it would be very easy to murder a vulnerable relative in order to get an inheritance.', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because killing is wrong whether it is willingly or not', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because killing someone is wrong even if they want you to do it', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because no one has a right to take another persons life or to help them', "assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because pain makes people do some extreme things, but it shouldn't include death.", "assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because people shouldn't be able to help murder others", 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because that is murder', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because the person is basically killing the other person.', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because what if the person being assisted was in only a bad emotional state which could be cured with professional health.', "assisted suicide should be a criminal offence for the god's law. god decide your life.", 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offense because at the end of the day somebody is dead and you had a hand in it.', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offense because death is death, at the end of the day someone is dead and you had a hand in it.', "assisted suicide should be a criminal offense because it's just a different name for murder", 'Assisted suicide should be a form of murder or pre meditated murder. People should die naturally not by suicide.', 'assisted suicide should be criminalized as no human being has the right to determine whether another human being lives or dies', 'assisted suicide should not be an option just because people are in pain as there are other options to help with this', 'assisting someone with suicide is equivalent to murder and that person has a moral obligation to report that persons intentions to authorities', 'assisting suicide is the same of assisting murder. both are crimes.', 'assisting to suicide is still an accessory to murder', "assisting with suicide is helping kill someone, and should be treated as such. the intent of the victim doesn't matter, murder is murder.", 'doctors take an oath to do no harm - assisting in suicide violates this', 'ending a life is a crime no matter the reason.', 'ending a life is unlawful regardless of the reason.', 'Giving someone the medicine to end a life other than natural causes is assisting in murder.', 'helping a human being to commit suicide devalues human life and can lead to deaths of unstable people who are not mentally competent to make the decision. it should be criminalized.', 'Helping people die because of tough times in their life is not right. There are many tools to help people get through bad times and helping them die is like pulling the trigger.', 'helping someone commit suicide is like killing them yourself.', 'helping someone kill themself is murder', 'helping someone to commit suicide is murder and should be criminalized', 'i think that an assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because is not legal', 'if not a criminal offence it could encourage murder under the guise of assisted suicide that would be difficult to prove.', 'if we make it a criminal offence then it may discourage people from committing suicide due to the repercussions that their families may face.', 'if you help someone kill themselves that is murder, and should be punished.', 'It is a criminal offense to kill someone and that is what someone assisting a person in committing suicide is doing.', 'it is possible that this could be used as a murder in some cases.', 'it should be a criminal offence because someone that may feel suicidal now might not feel that ay a few weeks down the line. they could go on to live a normal life if they get over the suicidal thoughts.', 'it should be a criminal offense to assist in a suicide because that is murder.', 'killing another person is wrong and should be banned', 'Legalizing assisted suicide may cause undo stress on other people with terminal illnesses. It might cause them to wonder if they are an undo burden on friends and family.', 'many people do not have the mental capacity to comprehend the finality of assisted suicide and it will be abused, and it should be a criminal offence to any persons involved.', 'Murder is murder no matter the circumstances', 'no doctor should take part in killing , it is their job to heal', 'no matter how much suffering we have in life nothing justifies death in the same way i think that a sick person is not in the capacity of whether he wants to live or not', 'no one should be able to get away with assisting suicide. it is nothing more than glorified murder. assisting should be replaced by helping these people find a better way to cope with their lives.', 'no one should have the right to take a life.', 'no other person should help you take your life', 'no-one has the right to play god and decide to help another person to die.', 'nobody has the right to take a life.', "nobody has the right to take someone else's life.", 'people may easily be manipulated into being a victim of assisted suicide by relatives with alterior motives', 'people need to die on their own as this would be almost like murder.', 'People wanting to commit suicide need mental and emotional help, not help in carrying out their plans to end their own lives.', 'providing someone the means to kill themselves is equivalent to pulling the trigger yourself', 'Some people would fake assisted suicide to actually murder someone.', "some vulnerable people might feel pressure to end their lives to ease their families. therefore, assisted suicide shouldn't be legal.", 'someone who would assist another person attempt suicide should be locked up. these people need help to be convinced that suicide is not the answer rather than assisted in their task.', 'suicide has never been legal. it is still killing, even if one is taking ones own life.', 'suicide in some countries is considered a crime for attempting against life itself, assisted suicide is the same', 'suicide is a criminal offense, thus assisting in suicide would be acting as an accomplice to murder.', 'suicide is a form of murder and those who attempt it can be convicted. assisting someone to commit suicide can therefore be considered an accomplice.', 'suicide is illegal and so is killing, so how is assisted suicide going to be legal?', 'suicide is never the answer and it is wrong', 'suicide should never be allowed and helping a person should be treated as murder. no person has the right to take a life. each person should be treated humanely and encouraged to live their natural life span.', 'TAKING A LIFE SHOULD BE WRONG REGARDLESS OF THE REASON IT IS BEING DONE', 'The Hippocratic Oath states, "First, do no harm" - assisted suicide violates a doctor\'s duty not to do harm to a patient.', 'the person assisting in an assisted suicide is committing murder and should be charged', 'the sanctity of human life should never be compromised so there is no question but assisted suicide should be a criminal offence.', 'there is no difference between assisted suicide and being an accessory to murder. suicide is immoral and those that help should be punished.', 'there is no safe system of assisted suicide and euthanasia anywhere in the world', 'there is too much potential for exploitation of assisted suicide by malicious relatives that it should be banned as a matter of individual safety', "there's the possibility that it could be used by those close to the person for financial gain or maliciously. you only have the word of the survivor that the person actually wanted to die.", "this is effectively commiting murder; no one has the right to take another person's life", "this would protect someone who's judgement may be impaired", 'we cannot allow people to assist suicide because there is a fine line between assistance and murder and to have to differentiate is complex ground.', 'Yes, because it is murder practically and this is considered a crime']
kep_points: ['Assisted suicide allows people to solicit someone to die to their own benefit', 'Assisted suicide is akin to killing someone', 'Assisted suicide should not be allowed because many times people can still get better', "Assisted suicide violates the doctor's role", 'People do not have the right to self-harm/harm others', 'People who are ill do not have clear judgement and are in need of help']
predict_kps(avg_embedding): ['Assisted suicide should be a criminal offense because it can lead to exploitation and murder of vulnerable individuals who may not have the capacity to make informed decisions.', 'Assisted suicide is a form of murder and those who assist in it should be charged with the crime.', 'Assisted suicide should be a criminal offense because it goes against the fundamental value of preserving human life and can lead to exploitation and abuse.', "Assisted suicide should be a criminal offense as it goes against God's law and the belief that He has ultimate authority over life and death.", 'Assisted suicide raises concerns about the potential for abuse and exploitation, particularly towards vulnerable individuals who may feel pressured to end their lives.']
predict_kps(PCA_embedding): ['Assisted suicide is a form of murder and should be criminalized as it involves actively helping someone to end their life, which goes against the moral and ethical principles of preserving human life.', "Assisted suicide is morally and ethically wrong, as it implies that one person's life is no longer valued or worth living.", "Assisted suicide is morally equivalent to murder and it's important to report any intentions of suicide to the authorities.", 'Assisted suicide is equivalent to murder and should be criminalized as it involves helping someone end their life, regardless of their intentions.', 'Assisted suicide is a criminal offense and those involved should be held accountable through imprisonment.']

topic: Assisted suicide should be a criminal offence
arguments: ['`people reach their limit when it comes to their quality of life and should be able to end their suffering. this can be done with little or no suffering by assistance and the person is able to say good bye.', 'A patient should be able to decide when they have had enough "care".', 'a person has the right to end their suffering and if somebody takes pity on them and chooses to help, that person should not be punished.', 'a person should have the dignity to choose how they die', 'a person should have the right to be able to choose if they want to live or die', 'a person should have the right to die on their own terms', 'a person should not be forced into having to live their lives suffering, when death is already enevitable', 'assisted suicide allows for a person who is sick and fully understanding what is done to end their pain when no quality of life can be assured', 'assisted suicide allows one to end terminal pain and suffering and should be allowed to continue.', 'assisted suicide allows people who have terrible health conditions to die with dignity. if assisted suicide is a crime they may have to endure many more years living in agony.', 'assisted suicide allows terminally ill people to die with dignity and should not be criminalized', 'assisted suicide allows terminally ill persons to choose when to die and do it with dignity. it lets people decide not to live in a state of pain and misery and choose to pass on with human intervention.', 'Assisted suicide and the right to live with dignity is a human right and should be made legal everywhere. It is a human right to choose not to suffer with a terminal illness.', 'assisted suicide gives people control over their life in terrible circumstances. it allows them dignity in death rather than living in terrible conditions for many years.', 'assisted suicide helps terminally ill people end their suffering', 'Assisted suicide helps those who are in pain due to a devastating disease end their own lives on their own terms.', 'assisted suicide is a blessing not a crime. a person who wants to be assisted in this is in great pain or has no ability to be cured, let someone give the suffering the chance to end it.', 'assisted suicide is a compassionate way to help people choosing to end their life in a nonviolent way.', 'assisted suicide is a great help for people who suffer from deadly diseases and are on their deathbed', "assisted suicide is a human right and would spare the terminally i'll pain.", 'assisted suicide is a humane and caring way to allow a person to help another person whose life is too difficult to be lived properly in any manner, so it should not be criminalized.', 'assisted suicide is a humane way to end a life as we do with animals in pain and should not be a criminal offence.', 'assisted suicide is a lot better than letting a person suffer until end of life.', 'assisted suicide is a personal choice on how a person wants to live his or her life and therefore should be legal by the constitution', 'assisted suicide is necessary in our modern world full of people dealing with pain and sorrow', 'assisted suicide is sometimes the only solution for some people, we should not take it off.', 'assisted suicide must be allowed. if a terminally ill person wants to end their life, allow them the peace of being able to with the help of a professional instead of potentially making it worse on their own.', 'assisted suicide should be allowed because it allows people with terminal illnesses to die with dignity before suffering a long and painful death.', 'assisted suicide should be allowed in certain circumstances such as when a person is suffering from severe illnesses.', 'assisted suicide should be made legal many people suffer with debilitating and painful illnesses and should be counselled and supported to make an informed choice', 'assisted suicide should be made legal so that those who have a terminal illness or are in uncurable pain can make an informed choice to end their lives with dignity surrounded by those they love.', 'assisted suicide should no be considered a criminal offence because a person could really be suffering and in pain and to let them suffer is heartless and inhumane', 'assisted suicide should not be a crime since the perpetrator was merely obeying the wishes of another.', 'assisted suicide should not be a crime. if someone is suffering on a daily basis from something that they are going to die from anyway, they should be allowed to die on their own terms.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal defense because in some cases, like people who have terminal cancer, you are doing them a mercy and saving them from suffering.', 'Assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence as people should not be expected to live in vegetative states and need help to make their own decisions to die a reality.', 'Assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence as people with no quality of life should not have to suffer indefinitely and their trusted helper should not be a criminal for helping them.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence because a person should be able to decide how and when they want to die.', "assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence because if someone doesn't want to live they shouldn't be forced to", 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence because it helps to ease the suffering of those who will never recover from their illnesses or injuries.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence because it is sometimes the only way a person suffering a debilitating medical condition such as motor neurone disease can end there life.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence if the patients asking for it to be done to them', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence, because if a loved one is terminally ill, it provides them with the opportunity to die with dignity rather than suffering until they die naturally.', "assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because if a person doesn't want to live, why should they be forced to", 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because if someone is in enough pain and is sane enough to decide, they should have that choice.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because it helps people who are in constant pain due to a terminal illness', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because when a person get gravely ill they should not have to keep on suffering.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because when you get so sick with no hope left, one should be able to end the pain.', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense since it should be a personal decision what a person wants for themselves. it could prevent months or years of pain for someone with no quality of life.', "assisted suicide shouldn't be a criminal offence because every human being should have the right to have someone assist them in passing should they determine they no longer wish to live", "assisted suicide shouldn't be a criminal offence because it allows the patient to have control over their final decisions", "assisted suicide shouldn't be a criminal offence because sometimes the person is in such pain or has no life just laying around in a bed", "assisted suicide shouldn't be a criminal offence if they are suffering from an incurable disease, they are going to die anyway", 'assisted suicide sometimes is the only thing that ends suffering.', "assisted suicide usually involves a terminal medical patient that is tired of fighting and being in agony. they should be allowed to 'check out' and receive help doing so.", 'assisted suicide would relieve much suffering by those with a terminal illness that is too much to bear.', "assisted suicide would save terminally i'll people pain and suffering.", 'assisted suicides are less painful and are an act of mercy', "assisting a suicide for medical reasons should not be considered a criminal offense because the person is making sound judgements based on someone else's suffering.", 'assited suicide allows those with a painful and terminal illness the ability to chose to end their life to cease the pain and suffering that would last for the end of their lives.', 'being able to die with dignity should be a right. when someone thinks their time has come, they should be able to die comfortable without worrying if having their loved ones nearby would get them jail time.', "Death with dignity is having the option to decide your own fate. You're able to take control of your own fate. It allows you to leave the world with your true self intact.", 'everyone should have the right to chose the direction they want to take, if someone is in unbearable pain with no quality of life then they should have the right to seek assistance.', 'for those with degenerative diseases, assisted suicide is often the only solace they have', 'if a patient is suffering with cancer or other painful conditions, they should have a right to end their suffering', 'If a person is already diagnosed with only a short time to live and is undergoing excruciating pain, assisted death is a compassionate support for the person.', 'If a person only has weeks to live, then assisted suicide may be the answer if all other possibilities have been exhaussted.', 'If a person was terminally ill and no treatments were working on them and they have only weeks to live, than assisted suicide should be a way out.', 'if a person who is dying anyway wants to end their life in a peaceful way then they should be able to do so.', 'if a terminally ill patient does not have assisted suicide available they may turn to another more violent method of ending their own life.', 'if people has a life ending illness they should be allowed to die', 'if somebody is going to commit suicide anyway they should be able to do it safely with assistance', 'if someone has an illness and is in constant pain, helping them end their misery is the humane thing to do and should be understood.', 'if someone is suffering from an incurable disease and is in great pain, it can be humane to help end their suffering.', 'if someone is suffering so much that they see suicide as the only way out, then criminalising their behaviour is likely to do more harm than good.', "if someone wants to die they shouldn't have to stay alive, so helping them to die is the beat thing to do. that shouldn't be a criminal offence.", 'if to a degree of reasonable certainty the state of seriousness can not be reversed by the medicine, the patient must have the right to end his life and if he needs help for that he should not be condemned', 'if to a reasonable degree of medical certainty the medical condition of a person is irreversible, it must have the right to terminate his life by requesting assistance without consequences for the fact.', 'it helps relieve some people from tremendous suffering', 'it is more humane to help the person die than to let them suffer excruciating pain', 'it is unfair to force someone with a terminal illness to continue to suffer greatly when they are just dying anyway. the only humane and compassionate way to help them is to allow assisted suicide.', "it shouldn't be an offence because is someone is seriously ill and in pain they have the right to end their own life if they are suffering.", 'many people are suffering terribly but are physically incapable of dying on their own', 'many people face a cruel and protracted period of suffering before their death so with compassion they should be helped therefore assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence.', 'People and family members must decide what they want to do with their life and body', 'people have a basic right to bodily autonomy, deciding whether or not to die with minimal suffering and dignity is integral to that right.', 'people have the right to die on their own terms and in their own time', 'people have the right to their bodies and if they wish to die they should be able to get help to do so.', 'people must be able to decide what to do or not with their lives therefore assisted suicide is an alternative', 'People should be able to ask for help in ending their own life if they are living with an incurable disease.', 'people should be allowed to die with dignity if they choose to.', 'people should be allowed to die with dignity instead of suffering a long painful death.', 'people should be free to help people out of their pain by helping them commit suicide without the fear of prosecution', 'people should choose what to do with their lives, even if it means ending it in whatever manner they choose', 'people should have the right to decide how and when they want to die, particularly if they are suffering from a terminal illness', 'people should have the right to die if they choose.', 'people should have the right to die. some people who are severely suffering without hope should be able to end their lives. sometimes this cannot be done without assistance.', 'people that are terminally ill should be able to choose whether they want to have to live suffering or whether they want to end the pain.', "people who are suffering with terminal illnesses with no hope of cure and in immense pain should be allowed to end their suffering. it's safer and painless done in a doctor's care rather than their own devices.", "people who are terminally ill and don't want to suffer any more have a right to ask for help to end their lives", 'people who are terminally ill and suffering greatly should have the right to end their own life if they so desire.', 'people who are terminally ill with no hope of survival should be spared the pain and suffering of living.', 'people who have no hope of living should have a choice to end their life', "people who have terminal illness or suffer from certain medical conditions should have the freedom to choose and if medical personnel helps them it shouldn't be treated as offence.", 'people whose quality of life is so poor that death would be preferable should be allowed to choose assisted suicide to end their suffering and pass with dignity', "people willing to die, it's their choice, should be able to leave this world in a civil way and helped with assisted suicide when needed", 'people with terminal illnesses are going to die. by not allowing assisted suicide we are making these people suffer deeply which in inhumane.', 'Some diseases are life threatening and can put a person in a no-living state. These situations are hard to bear for the ill person and for his family and relatives. only assisted suicide can make this ease', 'some patients have the utmost suffering and must end it as soon as possible', 'Sometimes people are so ill they have no quality of life and want to end it themselves but are physically unable ot do so, in thee cases it is only merciful for it to be legal for someone to help them.', 'sometimes people who are unable to end their own lives, are in so much pain and anguish that it is cruel to make them keep living, their loved ones need to be able to help them legally.', "terminally ill patients who just don't want to continue suffering have a valid reason to contemplate suicide, and someone who wants to help ease their pain should not be punished.", 'the end of life can be painful and humiliating, and we should allow people the right to decide when they are ready to end their own suffering.', 'the right to die is a personal choice and everyone has the right to make it happen if they truly wish', 'there are people who suffer from terrible illnesses who are mentally capable of saying "enough is enough". there is a realization that quality of life is so poor that death is a better option.', 'there is no reason for dying people to suffer unnecessarily', 'to assist a loved one to pass on and be relieved of suffering is a selfless act that should not be criminalised.', 'to enable a very sick individual to end their life should be seen as an act of kindness not a criminal offence as it takes great strength of character to be that enabler in what is a very difficult time.', "We don't allow our pets to suffer but because of religious doctrine we force humans to die in mental anguish and pain instead of decriminalising assisted suicide so they can die with dignity.", 'when people are in unbearable pain and suffering and have no chance of getting better it is cruel to keep them alive without their consent', 'when people are suffering, it is unfair to force them to continue to do so. if someone can assist them in ending the suffering, they should be able to.']
kep_points: ['Assisted suicide gives dignity to the person that wants to commit it', 'Assisted suicide reduces suffering', 'People should have the freedom to choose to end their life', 'The terminally ill would benefit from assisted suicide']

topic: The vow of celibacy should be abandoned
arguments: ['a priest chooses to make a vow to god to be celibate. he is not forced. if he chooses to become a priest he makes this vow. we should not try to take this away from becoming a priest.', 'a vow of celibacy is an individuals right as it affects no one but that person that makes the vow.', 'a vow of celibacy strengthens a persons character and beliefs.', 'being celibate is a huge sacrifice and so is a good way of measuring how much someone will sacrifice for their faith.', 'celibacy allows a man, or woman, to remain fully focused and committed to their dedication to god without outside distractions', 'celibacy allows a priest to concentrate on his job and his congregation without the complications that come with having relationships and families to deal with.', 'celibacy allows the priest to be completely focused on his parish community without distraction.', 'celibacy before marriage protects young people from disease', 'celibacy could have value in a world which is becoming more over populated.', "Celibacy has a positive side as it promotes self awareness and avoids pregnancy or sexually transmitted diseases. important part of priesthood and being holy.', 'celibacy is an important part of showing commitment to the church', 'celibacy is connection to the god and any banning on it would be sin and should not be touched.', 'celibacy is the only 100% effective way to prevent pregnancy', 'Celibacy promotes discipline and the love of God in clergy and should be maintained.', 'celibacy should not be abandoned to do so.', "if you cannot adhere to a vow of celibacy then don't make it", 'it is a proper choice of each person who chooses celibacy, so i do not think that it should be abandoned by demand', 'it is a requirement for christianity and each religion has its rules and must be respected', "it is a vow that has been a long held tradition in the church and shouldn't be changed", "It shouldn't be abandoned because the people choosing that life know that they are required to be celibate and it's a decision that they make for themselves.", "no need to abandon the vow of celibacy because it tests prohibited.", "Taking a vow of celibacy is an individual's right of choice in a free world that should be allowed and totally respected.", 'the holy scriptures say many things that are not accepted by the traditions of the church, so that the man who wants to remain holy must be celibate.', 'the marriage would be a big distraction to priests and they should devote their life and time to god and preaching', 'the teachings of the catholic church go back centuries and celibacy is one of the fundamentals that cannot just be abandoned without harming the whole concept of catholisism.', 'the urge of physical needs may interfere with the ability to be a good religious person, celibacy allow clergymen to focus on higher things', 'the vow of celibacy allows a priest to concentrate solely on god and hi parish without distractions. it means a priest has more time and energy for both his people and his god.', 'the vow of celibacy allows priests and nuns to concentrate on helping others and moral fortitude and should not be abandoned.", 'the vow of celibacy is a fundamental pillar of catholicism and we can not abandon it', 'the vow of celibacy is a personal choice and should be left to 'the vow of celibacy keeps individuals focused on important issues and not on their own personal life', 'the vow of celibacy keeps the honor and respect of the priesthood', 'the vow of celibacy must relationship to god without carnal distractions.", "the vow of celibacy symbolizes a priest or nun's commitment to their calling, and is an important show of faith.", "the vow of celibacy when used honestly means more focus on the flock than the priest's own family so should be kept.", 'the vow of celibacy, and those who choose to make that vow, should be respected. it should be a matter of individual choice for the individual.', 'they hold a very high title to which they agreed to be held by all rules.', 'this is a church tradition that needs to be upheld.', "this is a fundamental part of being a priest or nun. they don't need this distraction.", 'this is an established tenet of certain churches. abandoning it would infringe on their freedom of religion', 'this vow is a sacred thing and means the person has chosen to concentrate wholly on god not their own wants.', 'those adhering to a vow of celibacy show their dedication to their faith, such moral strength is something to be commended.', 'to remain celibate is to remain pure & should not be abandoned', 'traditionally some religions feel like the practice of celibacy ensures their members are purer.', 'vow of celibacy is important for some religious members and should be allowed to remain.', 'vows of celibacy are a way of expressing devotion and channelling ones thoughts away from desire into worship.', 'we live in a arguments: ['A state that outlaws murder cannot then turn around and murder prisoners in the name of the law. It is perverse and unjust.', "As long as death penalty is kept, this confirms that our society is founded on violence, and that violence and brute force solve. This mindset perpetuates the circle of violence and doesn't allow to escape it.", 'because there are a lot of innocent people who are in prison there is a good chance that you would kill a person and would later find out that they did not commit the crime', 'capital punishment breaks the human rights of the individuals being punished.', 'Capital punishment can be replaced by more ethical but equally punishing alternatives, like life without parole.', 'capital punishment can often cause great pain when being implemented and does not deter violent crime which is often committed in the throes of rage not to mention the injustice to the wrongly convicted.', 'capital punishment can potentially lead to the death of innocent men. there are cases where there is strong doubt that the person executed actually carried out the crime.', 'capital punishment can suffer from social or racial bias and in fact be used as a weapon against a certain section of society', 'Capital punishment denies due process by making it impossible for new evidence or good behavior to change the sentence.', 'capital punishment does not belong in a civil society', "capital punishment doesn't stop a crime.", 'capital punishment dose not work and is barbaric.', 'capital punishment has already led to innocent people being put to death, we should not allow this to happen.', 'capital punishment has been proven ineffective in reducing crime rates.', 'capital punishment has been shown by studies to just make kids think that violence can be answered with violence.', 'capital punishment has done nothing to actually deter serious crime in this country', "Capital punishment has historically been unfairly used more against minorities and the weak people in society, and I believe it's true today", 'capital punishment is a barbaric and inhumane practice that is outdated.', "capital punishment is a barbaric practice that is outdated and shouldn't exist in a civilized society.", 'capital punishment is a barbaric practice which gives men too much power.', 'capital punishment is a conscious act of murdering someone', 'capital punishment is a massive transgression of the dignity of life, which should have no exceptions.', 'capital punishment is an immoral act.', 'capital punishment is an outdated system that needs an upheaval.', 'capital punishment is an unfair attempt to the sanctity of life. no offender merits this kind of sentencing', 'capital punishment is applied unfairly among the different races, so it should be replaced with a better form of punishment that treats everyone equally.', 'Capital punishment is asymmetrically enforced against people of color and religious minorities.', "capital punishment is barbaric, ties up a lot of resources, and doesn't really act as a deterrent to major crimes.", 'capital punishment is basically taking the life of an unarmed, helpless person.', "capital punishment is cruel and in some cases people have been punished for crimes they didn't commit", 'capital punishment is cruel and unusual punishment.', 'capital punishment is excessive, gruesome, and ties up resources unnecessarily.', 'capital punishment is expensive and inhumane.', 'Capital punishment is hypocritical by engaging in the behavior it is trying to prevent.', 'capital punishment is inhumane and often an unfit punishment for the crime', 'capital punishment is inhumane. by killing someone legally, you become as bad as the criminals.', 'capital punishment is irreversible, there are too many miscarriages of justice to justify retention of the penalty.', 'capital punishment is just ineffective. most states that still use it as punishment actually have higher murder rates and crime than those that do not.', 'capital punishment is morally wrong, since it can never be acceptable to take a human life; applying an act of violence as a response to an act of violence is not a solution.', 'capital punishment is not a moral way of dealing with crime.', 'Capital punishment is nothing more than state violence directed towards a person in vengeance, making it morally wrong and an unjustified form of punishment.', 'capital punishment is seen as a cruel and inhumane way of treating prisoners.', 'capital punishment is simply a waste of resources, and it does not serve as an effective deterrent to major crimes.', 'capital punishment is too risky as sometimes innocent people are killed. unless it can be known for certain that a person is guilty, capital punishment wiill always present too much of a risk.', 'capital punishment is useless. imprisonment is actually way better since criminal court could incarcerate innocent people', "capital punishment is violent and doesn't really help anyone.", "capital punishment is wrong because it's like committing murder.", 'Capital punishment normalizes government violence and having the power of life and death over citizens.', 'Capital punishment often comes at a higher cost to the state and taxpayers than simply leaving someone in jail for life, meaning that abolishing capital punishment would save time and pressure on the courts.', 'Capital punishment often goes wrong and leaves people suffering but still alive.', 'capital punishment should be abolished because man is not the one that should be making the decision to take a life, but leave that to the all mighty god.', 'Capital punishment should be abolished because too many innocent people are put to death because they have been wrongly accused.', 'capital punishment would be unfair to those who were wrongfully sentenced to death for a crime they did not commit.', 'Capital punishment wrongly gives governments the power to take human life.', 'capital punishments targets mostly men of color and sometimes even innocent people are put to death. you cannot make reparations to a person after you have killed them.', 'Crime rates in states with capital punishment is no different than crime rates in states without, proving that it is an ineffective deterrent.', "Crimes that get the death penalty are rarely premeditated, which means capital punishment doesn't function as a deterant.", 'Everyone is capable of being reformed, but that is impossible with the death penalty.', 'far too many innocent people have been hanged fir capital punishment to continue.', 'For a growing number of victims of violence, the thought of honoring our loved ones by killing another human being is not only counter-intuitive, but abhorrent', "Given that we can almost never guarantee that someone isn't wrongly convicted, we shouldn't have capital punishment because it can't be undone if new evidence comes out.", 'Government action informs citizens action, so government should not condone death in any way.', 'Government violence is more extreme than individual violence, making it so the death penalty is never justified.', "i believe abolishing capital punishment because it's murder. we shouldn't play god and decide if someone should live or die. we can put them in solitary confinement for life instead.", "if someone was found not guilty, they wouldn't be able to bring him back to life after being killed under false accusations", 'In places where capital punishment is legal, it is often used in discriminatory ways against minority groups, and therefore we should abolish it to prevent disproportionate punishment against the most vulnerable people in society.', 'Innocent people may be wrongly convicted and executed.', "it doesn't deter crime and it's simply about revenge. the innocence project has exonerated twenty people on death row, and with their limited resources i have no doubt the number is higher.", 'it has been proven that some people who were put to death were actually innocent of the crime.', "It has been shown that capital punishment doesn't deter crime, making it useless.", 'it is archaic and barbaric. it is government sanctioned murder.', 'it is inhumane and teaches that violence solves violence until the justice system is 100% correct all the time, we cannot risk killing someone that may later be proven innocent', 'it is inhumane and unnecessary it teaches that violence is a solution it can open the door to abuse', 'it is never a good message to propagate - that taking a life solves any problem', 'it is possible that we could provide capital punishment to an innocent individual.', "it's not fool proof enough. the system already mistakenly punishes innocent people at an alarming rate. the risk of an innocent person being put to death is too great.", 'killing people is wrong, no matter what crime they committed', 'killing someone, outside of self defense, is never a positive choice.', 'Many death row inmates have been proven to be innocent once new forms of forensic analysis has been invented.', 'Many executions are botched and thus produce excessive and unjustified pain and torture', 'many innocents have been killed as a result of capital punishment. even one innocent killed is one too many.', 'No-one has ever proven with numbers that killing murderers stops other people committing similar crimes', "nobody has the right to take another person's life no matter how evil that person may be.", 'occasionally an innocent person is executed', 'other resolutions, such as incarceration and rehabilitation can help save a life rather than end one as all human lives are sacred.', 'recent dna evidence have proved that some death penalty inmates to be innocent. executing one innocent person is an enough proof that the capital punishment should be abolished.', 'repaying violent crime with a violent punishment makes us no better than the criminals.', 'Retribution as a principle of punishment is fundamentally unjust, and capital punishment does not serve any of the other purposes of punishment, such as deterrence and rehabilitation.', 'Since abolishing the death penalty in 1976, murder rate in Canada has steadily declined and as of 2016 was at its lowest since 1966', 'taking a life is an irreversible decision, and there have been many proven miscarriages of justice in past that could not be remedied due to such punishment.', 'the capital punishment is a setback of the current civilization', 'the criminal justice system is too flawed to render such a permanent punishment.', 'The death penalty goes against our most basic human right - the right to life', 'the death penalty has never been proven as a detterent to crime.', 'The death penalty is a form of revenge which continues the cycle of violence.', 'the death penalty is a racially biased punishment, and also ineffective in deterring crime', 'the death penalty is a violation of the human right to life', 'The death penalty is incompatible with human rights and human dignity', 'the death penalty is not an effective deterrent to crime', "the death penalty is outdated and immoral - there is no justification for taking a person's life.", 'The death penalty leaves everyone involved in the criminal justice system with residual guilt and trauma over sending someone to their death.', 'The death penalty perpetuates the cycle of violence.', 'The death penalty scars the family and friends of the person subject to it.', 'the death penalty typically brings the opposite of what survivors of crime most need', 'the government shouldnt have the power to say who lives and who dies.', 'the most obvious reason to oppose is the danger that an innocent person is killed due to the fact that mistakes are made. witnesses can be wrong in what they saw and lawyers can make a hash of defending a case.', 'The nature and methods of execution used around the world only continue to perpetuate the cycle of violence', 'The purpose of punishment should be to rehabilitate people so that they can re-enter society as productive citizens, and capital punishment does nothing to serve this purpose.', 'there are better ways of punishing criminals nowadays and some can be rehabilitated.', 'there are many instances of innocence being proved at a later date', 'there are too many historical cases where innocent people have been put to death.', 'there have been instances where the person that faces capital punishment was later found to be not guilty of the crime that they have been accused of.', 'There is ample evidence showing that capital punishment does not constitute effective deterrence.', 'there is no credible evidence that capital punishment acts as a deterrent', 'There is no credible evidence that the death penalty deters crime more effectively than a prison term', 'There is not credible statistical evidence that capital punishment reduces the rate of homicide', 'this type of punishment is wrong because no one deserves to be treated that way', 'to provide an example of acting as we wish others to act, we should not kill those who commit serious crimes. doing so puts humanity on their level and excuses their behaviour on an existential level.', 'Unlike prison sentences, the death penalty is irreversible and irreparable', 'We have seen too many cases of overturned judgments as new technologies and evidence have come to light, rendering capital punishment inherently problematic.', 'we should abolish capital punishment because in term of religious view, god is the author of life and death so only god can decide who die and who lives when times comes.', "we should abolish capital punishment because it is inhumane to kill a human being. an eye for an eye doesn't do us any good. they just need to be changed to a better person, not killed.", 'we should abolish capital punishment because sometimes people are wrongfully accused and once dead cannot bring them back so life in prison is better', 'we should abolish capital punishment because there is no possibility of correcting a miscarriage of justice where people have died for crimes they did not commit.', 'We should abolish capital punishment because these criminal caught already and put in jail and in spiritual aspect there is a possibility they repent and perhaps become a role model not to commit crime anymore', 'we should do because if a person has committed a crime they have to live with it for the rest of their life in prison, if they are executed its the easy way out.']
kep_points: ['State-sanctioned killing is principally wrong', 'The death penalty harms the disenfranchised', 'The death penalty irreversible', 'The death penalty is a waste of resources', 'The death penalty is ineffective in deterring crimes']
predict_kps(avg_embedding): ['The death penalty is not justified because it represents government-sanctioned violence that is more extreme than individual violence.', "The abolition of capital punishment is necessary to ensure the protection of human life's sanctity and prevent unjust sentencing.", "Abolishing capital punishment is necessary because it's morally equivalent to murder and violates the right to life.", 'The risk of executing innocent people highlights the need to abolish capital punishment.', 'The abolition of capital punishment is necessary for a more ethical and just society.']
predict_kps(PCA_embedding): ['The government should not have the authority to decide who lives or dies, as it goes against the moral principles of preserving human life and violates human rights.', 'The risk of executing innocent people highlights the need to abolish capital punishment.', 'Capital punishment should be abolished because it is inhumane and unnecessary, promoting violence as a solution and risking abuse.', 'The abolition of capital punishment is necessary for a more ethical and advanced society.', 'The death penalty is not justified because it represents government-sanctioned violence that is more extreme than individual violence.']

arguments: ['A basic principle of punishment is that it should be proportional to the crime, and therefore capital punishment is the only legitimate response to a crime such as first degree murder.', "Abolishing capital punishment is impossible. It is mostly used today by dictatorial countries and religious monarchies, and they don't obey world norms and suggested human rights", "Abolishing capital punishment means the victims' families will pay their taxes to support offenders who ruined their and their loved ones' lives. There is nothing merciful or humane in this; it is a sick, cruel joke.", 'As the only actor that can legitimately wield the use of force, the state has an reparative obligation to victims and their families to seek retribution against criminals, and this includes the use of capital punishment.', 'By taking away the right to life of his victim, a murderer forfeits his own right to life.', 'capital punishment acts as the ultimate deterrent - serious crime levels will drop due to the risk of paying the ultimate price.', 'capital punishment acts as the ultimate deterrent for the most heinous of crimes, and saves vast amounts of money that would be spent keeping such offenders in jail for ever more.', "capital punishment allows for equal justice type punishment and a means for the victim's family members to have some type of closure to such a horrible episode in their lives.", 'Capital punishment allows for more judicial discretion by providing more possible punishments to choose from.', "capital punishment allows for victims' families to get justice equal to the crime committed (usually murder).", 'capital punishment can be a deterrent if criminals know this is the ultimate punishment', 'capital punishment can influence better behavior', 'Capital punishment can provide more catharsis for victims than life in prison.', 'capital punishment can serve as a useful deterrent to prevent crime as people who are thinking about committing heinous crimes may have second thoughts as they know they put be put to death themselves.', 'capital punishment disincentives people to commit crimes', 'Capital punishment frees up space in jail, allowing for less prisons overall.', 'capital punishment has been proven to deter violent crime', 'capital punishment helps deter serious crime.', 'capital punishment is 100% effective as a deterrent to the criminal being executed; that killer cannot commit any more crimes', 'capital punishment is a needed last threat to keep kids in line how need discipline in their lives.', 'capital punishment is a real deterant to crime and should not be abolished.', 'capital punishment is a strong deterrent. if someone know they will be put to death for committing a crime they will be less likely to do it.', 'capital punishment is a viable last resort for serious offenders with no possibility of rehabilitation.', 'Capital punishment is an important deterrent to those who may consider committing a serious crime.', 'Capital punishment is beneficial to society: you are removing a murderer from society who could possibly kill again, even while in prison.', 'capital punishment is good at keeping dangerous criminals off of the streets.', 'Capital punishment is more humane than leaving someone to rot in a prison cell for the rest of their life and other punishments like solitary confinement.', 'Capital punishment is more humane than other extreme punishment like permanent solitary confinement or guard abuse.', 'capital punishment is needed as a deterrent to murder.', 'capital punishment is often the only viable response to certain crimes and should be upheld', 'capital punishment is preferable to costly appeals that the taxpayers have to cover.', 'capital punishment is the best method to ensure that a murderer does not kill again', 'capital punishment is the best way of stopping a murderer from killing again.', 'capital punishment is the most cost effective method of dealing with sociopaths', "Capital punishment is the most fitting retribution for heinous crimes such as serial killings or child rape - and sometimes even it isn't enough.", 'capital punishment is the only real solution for criminals who commit terrible crimes.', 'Capital punishment keeps prisons safer by keeping the prison population from being exposed to particularly awful criminals.', 'capital punishment must be retained as the ultimate punishment for the most heinous crime. an example needs to be shown to others that this in a consequence of you actions think again.', 'capital punishment provides a more effective deterrent that simple fines, penalties or light sentences in prison.', 'capital punishment provides a punishment that is equal to the crime committed. if you kill you should expect to be killed.', 'capital punishment provides both the ultimate deterrent, and the ultimate penalty, for the most heinous of crimes.', "Capital punishment provides closure for victim's families who can be reassured that the perpetrator can literally never harm anyone again.", 'Capital punishment provides permanent closure to victims and their families who have experienced immense trauma and have been subjected to intense pain by the criminal.', 'capital punishment provides solace to the loved ones of the deceased that the criminal will not be set free again.', 'capital punishment provides the best outcome for the families of victims. they can rest easier knowing that the person who harmed their family person can no longer hurt anyone.', 'capital punishment remains a good deterrent for serious crime', 'capital punishment sends a message to other criminals that if you commit an awful crime you will be severely punished', 'capital punishment serves as a deterrent for criminals. they see the negative consequences of the actions of themselves and others.', 'capital punishment should remain in affect as a deterrent to horrific crimes so that these types of crimes do not get out of hand.', 'criminals that have committed terrible crimes should not continue to be a burden to society.', 'dangerous criminals that can not be rehabilitated and are a danger to society should be subjected to capital punishment.', 'death penalty brings closure to families and saving taxpayers millions of dollars every year', 'for some people the crimes committed are so horrendous that the perpetrator must never be allowed to spend time with decent people again, the only way to guarantee this is by capital punishment', 'Guilty people deserve to be punished in proportion to the severity of their crime. Thus, the death penalty is a just punishment for murder - a life for a life.', 'if a person cannot and will not change, and would re-offend on release by killing others, then they should be stopped and should not be an expense to the taxpayer.', 'if reserved for extreme cases, capital punishment can send a strong message that society condemns such crimes.', 'if someone is guilty of heinous crimes it is only fair that they suffer the consequences', 'If someone murders someone else, they have given up their human rights, including the one to stay alive themselves', 'if you kill or rape someone you deserve to die.', 'In places where capital punishment exists, there is generally popular support for it, and the government should construct legal systems that most conform to the will of the people.', 'it is better to retain the death penalty because imprisoning people for the most serious crimes is not a good use of public funds in the long-term, particularly in the case of life sentences.', 'it will set bad example for others that people can get away with doing anythings and this will certainly increase crime rate', "it's the best deterrant there is to committing heinous crimes.", 'killers need to be eliminated for the safty of society.', 'knowing that capital punishment is allowed in more than 20 states in usa is a proof that kind of punishment could be productive.', 'many people deserve to die for their actions', 'murderers deserve to have a capital punishment.', 'Part of the purpose of punishment is to prevent dangerous people from committing further crimes, and capital punishment serves as protection against the most heinous offenders.', 'potential criminals will be scared to suffer such harsh punishment and as a result, they will be hesitant to commit crimes', 'recent investigations consistently demonstrate a strong link between executions and reduced murder rates', "serious crimes deserve serious punishment. at it's simplest level, 'an eye for an eye' is still a compelling argument for criminal justice.", 'some crimes are so despicable that death is the only appropriate punishment', 'Some crimes are so heinous and inherently wrong that they demand death penalties', 'some crimes are so heinous that the only just punishment is the death penalty.', 'some crimes are too grievous for a simple prison term and capital punishment is very important.', 'some criminals are too dangerous and have to be dealt with effectively, and capital punishment is the only choice.', 'some criminals are too wicked to be allowed to escape without true justice', 'some murderers are so brutal they must be executed', "some people have committed such unspeakable crimes that they don't deserve to live", 'some people need more extreme punishments to stop them from their bad behavior and keep the public safe.', "strict capital punishment brings justice and closure to the victim's family", "taxes shouldn't have to pay for criminals to live comfortably after they've committed horrific crimes.", 'the death penalty and capital punishment serves as an effective deterrent to discourage people from committing crimes.', 'the death penalty gives the victims of the worst crimes justice and takes away the option that they could be released to commit these crimes again', 'The methods of execution have gradually become more humane over the years making the death penalty quick, painless, and humane.', 'the modern death penalty is intended to be painless and effective and the process is much more humane than electrocution, firing squads, or hanging, which were common in the past', 'the old saying "an eye for an eye" exists for a reason. if a person commits a horrible act, than swift punishment is not only a good thing but deserved.', 'the punishment should be equal to the crime. it also might deter others from murder if they know they will lose their own life.', 'there are crimes for which it is the only response', 'there are some crimes so heinous, such as child rape and murder, that capital punishment is the only appropriate punishment for the crime as well as to act as a deterrent to others', "There cannot be a just retribution for mass murder, for example, but surely death sentence would be closer to justice than subsisting such a murderer till the end of his days at the taxpayer's expense.", 'too much of our taxes go towards paying for bad people, capital punishment would reduce jail spending.', 'very long sentences lead to a lot of taxpayers spending', 'very long sentences represent a huge expense for taxpayers', 'We have the responsibility to punish those who deserve it', 'we need capital punishment to deter serious crimes', 'we should continue to honor capital punishment because there are individuals that have done taken innocent lives and do not deserve to continue to live when there victim cannot.', 'we should keep capital punishment because killers dont deserve to live. a life for a life.', 'we should not abolish capital punishment because it brings fair closure for those that are suffering because the criminal still lives. in most cases because their loved one was murdered by the criminal.', 'we should not abolish capital punishment because it deters terrorism.', "we should not abolish capital punishment because people who have taken someone else's life should be made to pay the ultimate price of their own life.", 'we should not abolish capital punishment because the people that are given capital punishment murder so why should they live', 'we should not abolish capital punishment because there are some heinous crimes which deserve the death penalty.', 'When someone dear to you is horribly mudered and mutilated, you understandably want retribution and justice, and in extreme cases you deserve it', 'When someone takes a life, they forfeit all rights to their own life and should be punished to the fullest extent of the law.', 'When the death penalty is performed, there is no chance for the individual to escape and commit another crime', 'why should evil people be taken care of their whole lives while in prison. killing them saves money.', 'With the creation of DNA testing and other new forensic analysis, we can eliminate uncertainty in the guilt of people who deserve the death penalty.', 'Without capital punishment truly dangerous perpetrators always have the potential of finding some way out of jail and causing more harm to society.', 'Without harsh punishments for their offenses, criminals will be taking advantage of weaker people and victims']
kep_points: ['The death penalty helps the victim/their family', 'The death penalty is proportional', 'The death penalty prevents crimes', 'The death penalty saves costs to the state', 'The death penalty is acceptable in cases of severe crimes']
predict_kps(avg_embedding): ['The importance of capital punishment as a means of justice for heinous crimes.', 'Capital punishment serves as a fitting punishment for heinous crimes like child rape and murder, while also acting as a deterrent to others.', 'The query suggests that capital punishment should be abolished because it is not an effective deterrent and perpetuates a cycle of violence, while also highlighting the need for alternative solutions to address the root causes of crime.', 'The idea that capital punishment is the only appropriate response to certain crimes, such as first-degree murder, stems from the principle of punishment being proportional to the crime.', 'The idea that murderers deserve capital punishment is a common misconception, as it ignores the fact that the death penalty has been proven to be an ineffective and inhumane form of punishment.']
predict_kps(PCA_embedding): ['The abolition of capital punishment may lead to an increase in criminal activity as offenders may feel emboldened to commit crimes without fear of severe consequences.', 'Capital punishment serves as a fitting punishment for heinous crimes like child rape and murder, while also acting as a deterrent to others.', 'The state has a moral obligation to seek justice and retribution for victims and their families through the use of capital punishment.', 'The abolition of capital punishment could lead to the release of dangerous perpetrators who may continue to harm society.', 'The guilty should suffer consequences.']

topic: We should abolish intellectual property rights
arguments: ['abolishing intellectual property rights allows people to do great things.', 'abolishing intellectual property rights will give people more access to information', 'abolishing intellectual property rights will help people to use everything what can find it useful without worry about copyrights.', 'Another person might be able to make a concept work far better than the original person who thought up the idea.', 'art would probably be a lot better without intellectual property rights', 'enforcing property rights is almost impossible when companies in numerous countries do not enforce the rules very well such as china etc so it is easier just to abolish them', 'having intellectual property rights hinders progress and stops other people developing and improving projects', 'ideas and products need to be available at a fair price for everyone, allowing companies to have their intellectual rights means they can charge far too much to people who need that service or product.', "ideas are free thoughts so it's not fair for one person to profit off of it", 'ideas can not be owned or regulated, therefore they do not belong to a singular person', 'ideas should be everyones not just one persons', 'if someone holds the intellectual property for a specific abstract idea, they can prevent further development of that idea, which is not good for society.', 'information should be freely available to all', "intellectual endeavors are not isolated and it's possible for more than one individual to have the same ideas and inspiration", 'intellectual properties allow large corporations to have monopolies over their products and restrict the free market.', "intellectual property is such a vague concept in many cases, to have a right to it stiffles others' creativity.", 'intellectual property is used to smother business, it effectively destroys the free market', 'intellectual property rights are a barrier to innovation and further improvements to an idea by blocking others capitalising on ideas and technology', 'intellectual property rights are absurd, we deserve to express what we think it does not matter if another already thinks so', 'intellectual property rights are difficult to identify and regulate', 'Intellectual property rights are ephemeral and hard to define. How do you protect an idea once it has been voiced, They are useless and should be banned.', 'intellectual property rights are expensive to maintain and hold back the spread of new ideas', 'Intellectual property rights are old fashioned because now many people can come up with an idea and not get it patented but still be successful', 'intellectual property rights are ridiculous and do not foster ideological growth', 'Intellectual property rights are too hard to keep track of and monitor', 'intellectual property rights are too hard to maintain. we should do away with them and just let life happen.', 'intellectual property rights are too vague,they include copyrighting words, gestures, etc and should be sbolish', "intellectual property rights are unhelpful to companies who want to copy other people's ideas", 'intellectual property rights benefit the big corporations more than individuals as they can spend millions creating and patenting ideas which just makes them more powerful', "intellectual property rights can be granted to those who don't deserve protection", "intellectual property rights don't work. we see this with piracy websites as well as state actors such as china. there is no point in holding onto a broken system.", 'intellectual property rights get in the way of sharing information.', 'intellectual property rights give large corporations license to price gouge through their monopoly on unique ideas and this causes a great burden on consumers and society at large.', 'intellectual property rights hurt the flow of information.', 'Intellectual property rights keep people from making needed improvements to ideas first thought of by someone else.', 'intellectual property rights leads to monopolies, which drives up the prices for consumers.', 'intellectual property rights limit creativity and put too much power in the hands of corporations which have the resources to crush the liberty of people who innocently re-post content.', 'intellectual property rights mean that access to the arts can be more expensive meaning that poorer people have less access than richer people.', 'intellectual property rights mean that it is too expensive to access literature and music. abolishing these rights would make art more accessible to all.', 'intellectual property rights prevent advances in technological innovation, by restricting arguments: ['a libertarian government with provide the lower classes with much needed resources.', 'a libertarian system allows and ensures that a person is free to do as they please as long as those actions do not impede or infringe on the rights of others.', 'adopting libertarianism will make citizens to feel more free and more relaxed and happy.', 'adopting libertarianism would allow the economy to grow since all the rules and regulations holding back businesses and entrepreneurs would be removed', 'adopting libertarianism would increase our freedoms, ending governmental tyranny', 'because it protects the rights of the individual to live as they see fit, it promotes acceptance of the rights of all individuals within society, creating a more inclusive society.', 'everyone should have a freedom of choice with less government intervention.', 'freedom and liberty should be promoted for all to prevent tyranny and oppression. libertarianism is the most effective way of achieving topic: We should ban the use of child actors
arguments: ['acting is an exhausting profession and deprives children of their childhood', 'acting is very trying. it places a huge strain on children, and many end up being abused or using drugs to escape the pressure.', 'acting puts too much pressure on children and they are too young to handle it', 'acting takes away the opportunity for a child to be able to live their lives like a normal child', 'acting takes children away from their education and normal childhood pursuits', 'because children are put into acting at a very young age they are not able to make that decision for themselves, it is not always something they want to do, but what the parents want them to do.', 'because many child actors end up pscyhologically damaged and neglected, ruining the rest of their lives', 'child actors are all too often traumatised or abused so their use should be banned.', 'child actors are at risk for abuse mentally and sexually which will destroy their development in life', 'child actors are exploited both by parents and the video industry, children should study and grow without working', 'child actors are exploited by adults and should be banned', 'child actors are exposed to far too many adult situations and are exposed to many harmful conducts in the acting world, therefore child actors should be banned.', 'child actors are exposed to too much of an adult world and are at a greater risk of being exposed to drugs and drink. many former child actors have ended up as addicts because of this.', 'child actors are for the most part thrown into a role they do not wish to be in, while their parents pocket the gains.', 'Child actors are forced to grow up way too fast, they are thrown into a world of drugs and sex at an early age. Kids should be away from all that until Hollywood is safe for them.', 'child actors are not able to make their own decisions and are placed in situations that they do not understand for the financial benefit of others and should be banned.', 'child actors are not mature enough to handle the pressures of show business.', 'child actors are notorious for being groomed by the industry and abused. we must keep them safe.', 'child actors are often exploited by the film industry and should not be used', 'child actors are often exploited by the film industry or their own parents.', 'child actors are often forced to grow up too fast in a way that stunts their development permanently.', 'child actors are often forced to grow up too quickly and lose out on a traditional childhood.', 'child actors are often pushed into this by their parents who take their money.', 'child actors are put in situation vulnerable to predators, miss opportunities of education as well as being able to form solcial bonds in the everyday world.', 'child actors are really doing labor and child labor is against the law.', 'child actors are robbed of their childhood and can face much emotional turmoil as an adult from missing this important step in childhood.', 'child actors are subjected to far too much pressure and are unable to live a normal life playing with friends and going to school. this pressure normally leads to health problems in later life.', 'child actors are too often exploited and abused in one way or another, creating too many problem adults or early deaths and as such, we should strive to eliminate their use.', 'child actors are treated as adults and miss out on the social and emotional maturity process that children need to become healthy adults.', 'child actors are treated poorly in the industry.', 'child actors are worked far too many hours, and that could cost them physically, emotionally, and in school.', 'child actors become adults far too quickly and should not be allowed to act until they are adults', 'child actors can be overworked and they can miss out on their education.', "child actors can be overworked and they can miss out on their education. this can lead to difficulties in later life if they don't graduate school with any qualifications.", 'child actors can easily get exploited and abused.', 'child actors do not get a proper education and as such, the use of child actors should be banned', 'child actors do not get to have real childhoods.', 'child actors do not get to live a proper young persons life and experience childhood play,
