to their wellbeing.', 'child actors get exploited in hollywood and this ban would stop that.', 'child actors lose the sense of a proper childhood.', 'child actors lose their childhood by working at such a young age, growing up in a stressful, toxic environment, instead of a loving family.', 'child actors miss out on socialization with kids their own age and fall behind in school', 'child actors often become ill adjusted adults and often fall into substance abuse', 'child actors often cannot cope with the fame thrust upon them and adults should therefor play child roles', 'child actors should be banned as they are not given a chance to live a normal life', 'child actors should be banned as they miss out on growing up properly in a stable family environment and get adequate education.', 'child actors should be banned because the children are often exploited for their roles and because they end up with more money than they know what to do with and often squander it on drugs and other vices.', 'child actors should not be used because they are introduced to an adult world that can cause corruption and addiction.', 'child actors too often grow up to be very troubled adults. this is unfair to them and as such, we should ban the use of child actors.', 'children are exploited by their parents and content creators for money', 'children are far too easy to exploit and they sometimes end up being far too precocious at an early age due to fame and all it brings.', 'children are naive and are often manipulated or not given fair compensation', 'Children are often used by their parents to make money just because they have a natural ability to act.', 'children are taken advantage of by adults who are just concerned about making money', 'children are vulnerable to being exploited by greedy entertainment corporation and are not protected from the dangers of the industry so we should ban child actors.', 'Children do not have sufficient autonomy to make decisions about careers, they should be protected from over directing parents and hence the use of child actors should be banned.', 'children do not have the maturity level to decide if a life in the entertainment field is something they want. it gets pushed by their parents while the child is possibly not prepared for that life.', 'children in film and tv are regularly exploited and ill-treated by vain and self serving producers who have no ongoing concern for the well being of their young charges and so they should not be used', 'children must live their childhood freely. we must prohibit the use of children actors to avoid possible psychological damage in children', 'children need to be in school and with their families not working', 'children often can not handle the fame and have issues growing up including drug use', 'children should be able to live a normal childhood instead of having to miss out on many things. in a way, it is a form of child labor.', 'Children should be allowed to grow up at their own pace, child actors have an abnormal upbringing and are exposed to things at an early age which makes it difficult for them to then lead a normal life.', 'children should be free to have fun and enjoy life not made to work in hire pressure situations so we should ban the use of child actors.', 'children should be learning and playing, not working', 'children should grow up going to school with their peers and playing with neighborhood friends. child actors are taken out of this environment and made to work in an adult environment.', "children should not be made to work because there parents want to benefit from them. by banning child actors we will ban parent's profits over childhood.", "children shouldn't have to work at all- they should be playing and learning.", 'for a parent to basically sell their child out as labor for their own purposes is wrong. children should be allowed to grow up in a normal environment.', 'if children are spending there time acting this will detract from their education as they will not have enough time to study.', 'it is important to remember that the films made by children actors, have toxic and sexual contents, which is not convenient for children, so we must prohibit it.', 'it makes children work when they are too young to be able to decide for themselves and they lose the time with school friends and just being a kid', "kids should be kids and not put to work. especially when some roles can cause emotional trauma and lasting effects when children's understanding of real and fake is often blurred.", 'kids whose parents pushed them into acting never had a choice, and worse, they never had the chance to be a kid.', "look at the tragedies of numerous child stars, it is very rare a child actor doesn't face trouble and actually become successful adults.", 'Many child actors are put under a huge amount of pressure to perform well and can be denied most of their childhood by unscrupulous adults that only want to profit from their talents.', "many child actors aren't taught how to cope with fame and end up turning to drugs and alcohol which is bad for them.", 'Parents often force their children into acting for their own selfish reasons', 'placing pressure and fame upon someone so young as been shown to cause mental problems in later life.', 'protects children from being overworked', use of child actors is dangerous for society as it supports the hyper-sexualization of all children in society.', 'the use of child actors shall be banned because fame at a young age rarely results in child actors should be banned as children are not capable of making important decisions and some do not have trustworthy parents to make rationale decisions.', 'the use of child actors should be banned because the work takes them from the education they will most likely need to obtain gainful employment in adult life', 'the use of child actors should be banned to end the exploitation.', 'the world of show has proven to be full of vices that in the case of children is very harmful', 'there have been many cases of child actors who end up addicted to drugs or alcohol', "there is a risk of children exploitation by forcing them to act things they wouldn't normally do in life", 'there is too much exploitation of minors in the entertainment industry. with advances in cgi, child actors can and should become a thing of the past.', 'they dont get the formal education that other children get and they might be too tired to study which might affect them academically', 'they may miss out on other things like schooling', 'this is child labor and child labor is illegal.', 'too much fame at a young age has proven to have ruined many lives', 'using child actors can create unimaginable pressure ans stress on the child if they become a star or the production is a success and this can lead to substance abuse problems to cope with said pressure', 'using child actors is exploitation, it prevent children from having a childhood, children will not chose this for themselves they are pushed into it by parents wanting their 5 minutes of fame and the money.', 'using child actors is exploitative and should be viewed as the same as child labor.', 'Using child actors only makes them more susceptible to drug use later on.', 'we do not allow child labour, child actors are working children, this should also be banned', 'we must not allow child labor wherever it comes from', 'we need to ban the use of child actors because it is causing them mental harm from the things they need to do', 'we should ban child actors as a part of banning child labour. exploitation of a child through working is wrong regardless of the specific job role', 'We should ban child actors because many of them end up having troubles later in life and they are put at risk when they are on sets instead of being with people their own age.', 'we should ban the use of child actors as they are not old enough to decide if that is what they want to do and it will impact their whole future.', 'we should ban the use of child actors as this is exploitation of children who, probably, are forced into working rather than choosing to.', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it exposed them to the horrors of the entertainment industry and cause drug addictions or mental issues when they get older', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it forces them to grow up too quick and could damage them when they get older.', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it is a form of brainwashing, exploitation and only exposing them to pedophiles out there', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it is important for them to concentrate on education and making money and fame at a young age can be harmful.', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it robs them of their childhood and forces them to grow up too fast.', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it strips them of childhood, let them be children and play and mess around', 'we should ban the use of child actors because it takes away their childhood and innocence and forces them to grow up too fast.', 'we should ban the use of child actors because they are too young to truly understand what they are doing, and hollywood has proven to be a dangerous place for children.', 'we should ban the use of child actors because they belong in school', 'we should ban the use of child actors because they need to be kids not waste their lifes acting', 'we should ban the use of child actors because they should be in school and learning', 'we should ban the use of child actors since it puts so much pressure on them. they should be growing up with a stable life and just enjoy being a kid.', 'we should band the use of child actors as this type of work is both physically and mentally damaging to the children.', 'we should prohibit this because it affects the development and normal behavior of children']

topic: We should ban the use of child actors
arguments: ['a talented child should be able to pursue their dreams and help make a story come to life.', 'acting at a young age not only gives a child the experience that is needed but it also gives them confidence as well as making money that they can use for later on in life', 'acting can be a very prosperous career, and it would be a shame to take this option away if a child is truly willing to do it.', 'acting can be an amazing opportunity for children which could potentially lead to a full career.', 'acting exposes children to a variety of people and places, giving them valuable life experience they would not receive otherwise.', 'acting is an art and not a job so banning the use of children in acting roles is preventing children from exploring their creative ability in that area and should not be banned.', 'Acting may be a dream for a child and we do not want to crush their dreams.', 'and if we forbid it, who will play the role of the children? this is a decision only of parents and children, the government should not get involved', 'are we going to make movies without children at all? banning child actors does not seem reasonable in this billion dollar industry.', 'as long as child actors are protected and monitored, their participation in the acting industry should be allowed.', "as long as it doesn't interfere with their schooling and they are well looked after i don't see a problem.", 'as long as protections are in place to care for vulnerable youngsters, child actors can be just as fulfilled and respected as their elders', 'as long as regulations are followed to protect the children, it should be allowed. they have an opportunity to save money for a head start on adulthood.', 'as long as the child is not forced and wants to act then they should be allowed', 'as long as the child really wants to do it and is being properly supervised, they should be allowed to act.', 'as long as there is proper protection for child actors there is no reason that they should not be able to perform on screen', 'Banning child actors would be denying many very talented young individuals from becoming something great from an early age.', 'banning child actors would impose serious limitations on the entertainment industry.', "Being a child actor can be a positive experience as long as a child's other needs are also met", "being able to portray children is an important part of today's media. there are already sufficient regulations in place to ensure the safety of the actors, and it gives children a financial head start.", 'child acting brings a revenue for people at a young age. if you have the gift to entertain then why not?', 'child actors are able to access school work on set, and have a protected upbringing. there is no need to ban the use of children in tv and films as there is no harm caused.', "child actors are an important part of the acting industry and should continue to be allowed with restrictions to ensure the child's well being.", 'child actors are carefully monitored and protected by current laws and should not be banned.', 'Child actors are fine to use as long as there is a responsible adult watching them.', 'child actors are important so programs can show people of ages and are reflective of society. child actors are an important part of the industry and are needed to reflect people accurately.', 'child actors are necessary and children can learn how to work even from an early age', 'child actors are needed for many roles in the television and movie industry.', 'child actors are needed for roles that could not be fulfilled by adults so banning their use would be impossible.', 'child actors are needed to fulfill certain roles', 'child actors are needed to play the roles of children', 'child actors are needed to ply childrens roles', "child actors are needed to portray children in movies and shows. we can't ban them.", 'child actors are protected by stringent health and safety regulations, they have to still receive schooling and the money they earn means they will be able to do the things they want as adults.', 'child actors are useful as it allows these children to earn a living doing something they enjoy.', 'child actors are vital to the entertainment industry.', 'child actors bring a lot of joy to the world, we should allow them to continue and just offer off better counsel if needed.', 'child actors can make a good amount of money for their future doing something they enjoy', 'child actors can secure a future for college with the earnings they make and can be protected by family and managers to insure their safety in their young acting careers.', 'child actors cannot be banned since a typical family would never be able to be depicted on film or television', 'Child actors have far wider experiences than other children giving them confidence and money that can enhance their adult lives.', 'Child actors need to be in acting because many movies and shows have child parts in them,', 'child actors should be allowed to work and contribute their talents to society.', 'Child actors should not be banned because who else would play the children in movies? And that cannot be avoided because children are a part of life, and therefore, part of many stories.', 'child actors should not be banned just because of a few bad apples. with good direction, these actors can go on to pay their own college costs and become responsible citizens.', 'child actors will do just fine with proper supervision and regulation', "children are humans too and with their consent and their parent's consent, should be allowed to work", 'children can learn a lot by acting, and they can be good actors under adult supervision', 'children play important roles in many television shows and movies. it would be a great loss not to have them performing.', 'children provide unique storytelling opportunities for movies and should not be banned as long as they are properly raised and cared for.', 'children should be free to do what they want with their consent and their parents consent', 'everyone has the right to develop their maximum potential regardless of whether they are children or adults.', 'how are you going to make tv shows and movies without children?', 'if a child is passionate about acting they should be allowed to pursue that dream', 'if a child wants to act they have every right to', 'if a child wishes to act and the mother and father agree they ought to be permitted to act because there are rules to protect them at work', 'if a child wishes to be an actor and they are given time to be a child, then it should be allowed.', 'if a parent sees that their child has the ability to get into the entertainment business at an early age, it should be encouraged. everyone wants a better life and if they can start early, great.', 'if acting is their passion they should be able to pursue that no matter what their age', 'if parents agree for their children to acting in movies, can`t see any problem with it.', 'if parents agree for their kids to do acting, i can`t see any problem with it.', 'if the child likes and wants to be an actor, they should be able to. it gives them extra benefits that other children do not acquire.', "if there are problems with kids and acting then just regulate it more and don't ban it completely", 'if they understand the risks they should be able to', 'if they want to be an actor it is their choice', "if we don't have child actors then we cannot create movies and dramas that other children can relate to.", 'it is not right to ban child actors if the child wishes to go to work in that field and achieve their wishes and progress.', 'it would be strange if no movies had children in them.', "it's necessary to have children in tv shows and movies and therefore banning them from acting makes no sense.", "it's the parents' decision whether a child acts", 'Kids are very important to movies and tv shows. Without them it would be dull. screening of children before allowing them to go into the profession.', 'many child actors successfully balance acting with school and grow up to be well adjusted adults.', 'Many children have a love of and a desire to go into acting and should not be prevented from doing so.', 'many films and television shows have child roles which could only be filled by children. as long as the children are protected it means that the finished product will have higher artistic integrity.', 'many great actors of today started as children and had no problem in their growth', 'movies and shows without children in them would feel incomplete and unrealistic.', 'should not be prohibited, children have to start developing their talents as a child, and prohibiting it would be cutting many opportunities', "talent needs to be nurtured at an early age, supported and encouraged - child actors are no different from any other minor with rare abilities, we wouldn't expect their gifts to be hidden away.", 'the role of a child actor cannot be fulfilled by adults to cannot possibly be banned.', 'the usage of child actors should not be banned as they are an important part of the acting field they have adults who can make rationale decisions for them.', 'the use of child actors helps the children learn a profession or skill that they can use to be a productive part of society.', 'the use of child actors is well regulated enough that there are no serious harms.', 'the use of child actors should not be banned as youthful actors can take on roles that provide inspiration for young people', 'the use of child actors should not be banned because there are many acting roles for children that would not otherwise be accurately portrayed', 'the use of child actors should not be prohibited unless they are being exploited and abused. if it is for educational purposes, they must remain actors', "the use of child actors shouldn't be banned because it can help them grow into adults who have a good work ethic", 'there are enough rules and policies in place to protect child actors, making it a safe profession', 'there are many protections available for child actors to permit them to work and be safe', 'there are more safe guards than ever before in the hollywood industry to keep children safe while acting.', 'there is no logical reason to ban the use of child actors, they have protections so they are not overworked.', 'They are given a wonderful opportunity to provide their own wealth for when they are adults as well as the opportunity to have valuable life experience in acting.', 'to tell a story in theater or movies we need children actors. without them stories could only be about adults. stories that have entertained us from lassie to mary poppins would not exist.', "tv and theatre will always have a need for child actors, as long as it doesn't interfere with their education or place too much demands on them, then it shouldn't be a problem.", 'tv shows and movies need child actors to tell stories.', "use of child actors gives us a lot of great shows we wouldn't have if there were not child actors", "we can't ban the usage of child actors because these talented children have the right to perform and earn money. this early acting can lead them to stardom which might not otherwise occur later.", 'we must not prohibit the use of child actors because it goes against the right to work. children under the supervision of their parents can develop their artistic talent without affecting their personal growth', 'we should not arguments: ['A worker should not be forced to retire if he feels he can still adequately produce for his employer.', 'Allowing workers to choose when they retire can improve staff retention, increase workforce morale, and help employers retain vital skills and experience', 'as life expectancy and healthy ageing continue to grow mandatory retirement no longer makes sense.', 'as long as someone is capable of doing his job it should be his choice when to retire and not the decision of some bureaucrat.', 'As people continue to have children later and later, mandatory retirement prevents people from being able to provide for their family and dependents.', 'as people live longer and have variable health the concept that all need to retire at a set age is archaic and so we should end mandatory retirement.', 'as quality of life improves and the average lifespan increases, mandatory retirement looks more and more out of step with the modern human life experience.', 'citizens should have the right to choose when to withdraw', 'Ending mandatory retirement sends the message that workers of all ages have inherent worth.', 'everyone should have the choice when to retire.', 'Forcing members of a profession to retire at a certain age creates an experience drain', 'Forcing members of a profession to retire at a certain age creates an experience drain.', 'Forcing workers out of their position is unethical because it is likely to make them destitute and possibly homeless.', "if a person loves their job and isn't physically or mentally draining on them why should we force them to leave what they love? they may not be financially secure enough to retire as well.", 'if people are still able to do good work then there should be no reason to force them to retire', 'if people want to work passed a certain age it is their choice', 'if someone can still work they should be allowed. it will cause less strain on social security.', 'if the workers are still performing at an adequate level, they should not be forced to retire simply based on their age.', "in today's society people are living to a greater age and we should not penalise those people who want to continue working by forcing them to retire.", 'Individuals are the best arbiters of their own desires and good, they should be able to choose when to retire on their own. Mandatory retirement strips people of their agency and choice.', 'it forces more qualified people out of jobs & replaces them with less qualified people', 'its unfair to force people to quit working', 'mandatory retiremen pushes those with something still to contribute out of the workplace, which can be damaging to the persons wellbeing and health', 'mandatory retirement ages are inconsistent with modern workplace practices and are contrary to the desire for age equality', 'Mandatory retirement as a blanket policy is unnecessary, as those who are unable to perform their job can be released for cause without the policy, while valuable employees can remain.', 'mandatory retirement brings too much stress to both businesses who are now out a knowledgeable employee and to the person who now no longer has employment.', 'Mandatory retirement contributes to leaving older people feeling directionless after being forced to stop working against their will. This contributes to high rates of depression and other mental illnesses in older populations.', 'Mandatory retirement could force whole blocks of experienced veterans to retire every year, with a deleterious effect on industry', 'mandatory retirement denigrates the experienced professional who has worked for years. we must end this practice because it undermines the economic and emotional stability of the individual', "Mandatory retirement discourages productivity in the individuals who are nearing the age since they know they will have to leave their work soon and won't be getting any new promotions or bonuses.", 'mandatory retirement discriminates based on age, not ability and should be ended', "Mandatory retirement discriminates people based on their age, as it doesn't take into account the capacity of the individual to perform their job at a high level.", 'Mandatory retirement forces companies to exert resources in finding and hiring replacements for individuals they might not have been planning on replacing.', 'mandatory retirement forces people to end careers before they are ready', 'Mandatory retirement forces people who are still excellent at their jobs to quit working long before they are ready.', 'Mandatory retirement fuels social isolation in older populations because we live in a society that encourages the development of social lives around your work.', 'mandatory retirement is a form of age discrimination.', "mandatory retirement is age discrimination and shouldn't be allowed to happen.", 'mandatory retirement is age discrimination and therefore should be ended.', 'Mandatory retirement is age-based discrimination. It is discriminatory to assume that everyone who reaches the age of 65 or 70 is incompetent.', 'mandatory retirement is an extremely detrimental concept as businesses can lose their most valued and knowledgeable employees', 'mandatory retirement is bad for older workers', 'mandatory retirement is discriminatory and should be banned', "mandatory retirement is harmful to the nation's productivity and economy", 'mandatory retirement is harsh. it pushes workers who might still be viable out of the workforce for no other reason than their age, often leaving them to struggle.', 'mandatory retirement is not fair for those who are actually more than capable to carry on with their jobs', 'mandatory retirement is too much of a one-size-fits-all policy that refuses to take into account the physical and mental health of each individual worker.', 'Mandatory retirement is unconstitutional ageism because it discriminates on inalienable characteristics of the worker.', 'mandatory retirement is unfair to those who will still need the income to survive after a certain age.', 'Mandatory retirement makes the older generation the economic burden of the ones below them (since they can no longer support themselves) which is worse than just allowing them to keep working.', 'Mandatory retirement often forces out the most skilled and experienced members of the labor force, meaning from an economic perspective it leads to declined productivity and quality of goods and services.', 'mandatory retirement put high-skilled workers out of jobs. putting a pressure in the working field and jeopardizing economic progress', 'Mandatory retirement puts pressure on the government to maintain social services for older people such as Social Security and pension programs that benefit society as a whole.', 'mandatory retirement removes experienced personnel form the rosters who still have many working years ahead of them due to longer life spans.', 'mandatory retirement results in the loss of institutional knowledge, which can have devastating consequences.', 'mandatory retirement should be abolished as lifespans increase and older people are more able and active than ever, making the old retirement ages useless.', 'mandatory retirement should be ended as it is discriminatory.', 'mandatory retirement should be ended as it is unfair on older people.', 'mandatory retirement should be phased out as humans live longer, the old age markers for retirement become more and more out of step with how active older people are.', 'mandatory retirement should end because it cuts everyone off at a certain age. many people are able to work and need to work well past that age.', 'mandatory retirement should stop because older people should not be pushed out.', 'many older people are perfectly capable of contributing to the workforce. they should not be punished by being forced to retire at a particular age', 'Many people that are forced into retirement often do not have the means of supporting themselves financially, and so either turn to part time, low-wage work or welfare to sustain themselves.', 'many retirees are often below the poverty line, unable to heat their house and unable to eat a healthy diet. allow them the opportunity to work later in life to be able to improve their standard of life', 'no one should be forced to work or stop work against their will, this is hugely discriminatory and infringing on basic rights', "older employees have a wealth of knowledge and experience and forcing them to retire could put a company's productivity at risk.", 'Older workers have more experience and expertise than young workers.', 'people age differently so age is not a good tool to use to determine if someone should be working or not', 'people are living far longer than they used to and are not ready to retire at the age they used to. many need the income to support their longer lives', 'people are living healthier longer now and forcing retirement based on arbitrary guidelines like age is a bad idea.', 'People are living longer and healthier lives and often wish to continue working.', 'people are living longer and so creating an age where you have to retire could result in people being out of employment for over 30 years.', 'people are living longer and we do not have the right to stop them from working if that is what they want to do.', 'people are now living longer and staying healthy. they should be able to work as long as they are able to and contribute to our society.', 'people are valuable at any age and should be allowed to work for as long as they want to', 'people have the right to work until they want', 'people should be able to choose when they retire.', 'people should be able to continue working if they choose', 'people should be able to work as long as they want to.', "people should be able to work for as long as they're healthy and able to do the job.", 'people should be allowed to retire when they are ready', 'people should be allowed to work as long as they like', 'people should be allowed to work for as long as they want and as long as they are capable', 'people should have the choice to retire when they are able or want to. if someone wants to continue working for as long as the choose, that should be their right to do so.', 'people should not be forced to retire if they are still in good health and can still be useful for their companies.', "people shouldn't be forced to retire at a certain age because people all have different abilities at the same age and some can definitely still work.", 'people who are not financially prepared for retirement may not have the means to live out a financially secure retirement, and may be forced to go back to work at an even later age.', 'people who have gained a lot of wisdom and experience are an asset to any company and if they are perfectly healthy and wanting to continue to share their knowledge, they should have that option.', 'people who wish to continue working should be able to do so', 'prohibiting mandatory retirement promotes labour market supply and removes barriers to older people participating in society', 'some older workers love their job and would be devastated to be forced to stop working', 'some people are able to work way beyond the regular retirement age. they should be able work as long as they want and continue to be productive.', 'some people are capable of working way beyond the retirement age and should be able to work and increase their retirement funds as long as they ant.', 'some people are not ready to retire at the mandatory age and want to keep working', "some people are poor financial planners, some were dealt a bad hand in life and it's necessary to continue working past retirement or they won't arguments: ['access to information is a crucial right for a voter in a democratic society', 'better journalism is needed to keep our governments in check and the general population in the know', 'by subsidizing journalist, we can get a more truthful account of facts since they would not need donations.', 'Due to the rise of instant gratification online media and the fall of print media, journalism has been struggling economically a lot more in recent times. arguments: ['any subsidy for education after school is unnecessary, the right to access education ends at 16 at which point people can fund their own adult decisions', 'everyone should get a free
